channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Ardingly College: Six children and parent hit by Tesla
item.description: An eight-year-old boy is flown to hospital after several children are hit by a Tesla at a school.

item.title: Suffolk herb factory fire: Camstar in Eye burnt out
item.description: Dozens of firefighters spend the night tackling the blaze that started on Monday evening.

item.title: Hospital staff in shock after murder of nurse
item.description: Hospital bosses pay tribute to Eileen Barrott as police continue to search for her husband.

item.title: Banksy-painted building in Lowestoft taken off the market
item.description: He is "looking at his options", believing the mural could be worth more than the property itself.

item.title: Northamptonshire Weetabix workers strike over pay
item.description: A 24-hour strike at a cereal bar factory started at 19:00 BST on Monday.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca gets temporary reprieve ahead of review
item.description: An application for a temporary injunction to halt his death will be considered at the High Court.

item.title: From a Manchester council estate to ballet dancing in Swan Lake
item.description: Isaac Bowry is from a Manchester council estate and wants to show that "dancing is for everyone".

item.title: Who were the victims?
item.description: The gunman's mother, Maxine Davison, and three-year-old Sophie Martyn have been named among the dead.

item.title: Minute's silence is held for shooting victims
item.description: Five people were killed in the shooting on Thursday before Jake Davison took his own life.

item.title: 'Your memories will never leave us' - notes to the victims
item.description: Flowers and heartfelt messages are placed in Keyham in memory of the five people killed.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Who can own a firearm or shotgun in the UK?
item.description: A shooting in Plymouth which left six people dead has put the focus on who can own a gun in the UK.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Starmer asks why gunman had licence
item.description: The police watchdog is investigating the decision to give back Jake Davison's shotgun and certificate.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
item.description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Prayers to remember victims
item.description: Father David Way says it is a time of "shock, sadness and horror" following the shootings.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: 'My brain can't process it'
item.description: Jake Davison shot his 51-year-old mother, Maxine Davison, before killing four others.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: PM Boris Johnson - My thoughts are with the families
item.description: Boris Johnson also says it needs to be "properly investigated" how the gunman got a firearms licence.

item.title: Incels: A new terror threat to the UK?
item.description: Is the incel belief system followed by Jake Davison, the Plymouth gunman, a terror threat to the UK?

item.title: Plymouth Shootings: Home Secretary says many questions to be asked
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says she'll be looking for answers about the shootings that left six dead.

item.title: A visual guide to what happened
item.description: A gunman shot and killed five people in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself. Here's what we know about how events unfolded.

item.title: Shooting 'a truly shocking event' say police
item.description: Devon and Cornwall Police Chief Constable Shaun Sawyer explains how reports of the shootings came in.

item.title: Plymouth MP: Community 'trying to make sense' of shooting
item.description: MP Luke Pollard says the community is pulling together in the face of the "deeply grim" news.

item.title: Tower Hamlets: Murder probe after man attacked in cemetery
item.description: A man was found with a fatal head injury in Tower Hamlets Cemetery Park on Monday morning.

item.title: Derby County announces death of 'oldest football fan'
item.description: Derby County said it was "saddened" to learn of the passing of Derek Eley, aged 103.

item.title: Coventry daughter of woman stuck in Kabul asks for more troops there
item.description: Fereba Hafizi's mother is stuck there after flying to the country to attend a funeral.

item.title: Moped rider to tour UK's rude place names
item.description: Paul Taylor will visit towns such as Shitterton and Cockpole Green on the 1,800-mile charity tour.

item.title: 'Rogue wave' sweeps man to death in Cornwall
item.description: An inquest concludes that Tyler Westlake, who was swept off rocks while fishing, died accidentally.

item.title: Otter cub found in stream 'crying for mother' rescued by RSPCA
item.description: A member of the public spotted the young mammal alone and distressed near Windermere.

item.title: Cambridgeshire sinkhole: Locals crack up at The Butts' hole
item.description: A hole in a road called The Butts causes amusement on social media after police issue a warning.

item.title: Physio uses CPR and defibrillator on match official
item.description: Shannon Brooks is praised for helping save a match official who suffered a suspected heart attack.

item.title: Men hurt in homophobic attack at Birmingham's Gay Village
item.description: Rob and Patrick faced homophobic abuse and were hit with bottles during a night out in Birmingham.

item.title: Lancashire couple's narrowboat life fascinates YouTube users
item.description: Paul, Anthony and dog Dexter's life on board a narrowboat is viewed from around the world.

item.title: Weymouth rescue after deer spotted swimming in the sea
item.description: A fishing boat spotted the foal in the water near Weymouth harbour and it was brought back to shore.

item.title: John O'Groats to Land's End paramotor flight for dementia research
item.description: Daniel Jones says he wants to get younger people talking about dementia.

item.title: Car in near-miss with train on Cumbria level crossing
item.description: CCTV footage shows the car driving across the barrierless crossing in front of the Northern train.

item.title: Tammy Abraham: Roma sign striker from Chelsea for £34m on five-year deal
item.description: Striker Tammy Abraham completes a £34m move to Italian side Roma from Chelsea.

item.title: England women face New Zealand twice plus USA and Canada in autumn home Test series
item.description: England's women will meet World Cup holders New Zealand in back-to-back matches as the Red Roses contest four home Tests this autumn.
